title: Related rates with volume of cone

content.prompt: A container has the shape of an open right circular cone, as shown in the figure above. The container has a radius of 4 feet at the top, and its height is 12 feet. If water flows into the container at a constant rate of 6 cubic feet per minute, how fast is the water level rising when the height of the water is 5 feet? (The volume V of a cone with radius r and height h is  V = 1 3 Ï€ r 2 h MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4176@ .)

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
